bug.author: ghost(ghost)
bug.summary: compilation error when MKLDNN_VERBOSE is disabled
bug.description:
compilation error when MKLDNN_VERBOSE is disabled. In shuffle_pd.hpp LINE 47: virtual void init_info() override { init_info_shuffle(this, this->info_); } "init_info_shuffle" not found when MKLDNN_VERBOSE is disabled <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Windows 10 x64 Pro VS2017 15.9.5

comments.comment: Thanks for the report! Reproduced. A fix is under review.
Hi @zeno40, Just curious why do you prefer building Intel MKL-DNN w/o verbose support?
I'm just curious if there some (small) speed advantage w/o verbose support enabled. It's not something I really need in an application if there's no speed advantage.

The performance difference should be negligible, as long as you don't export MKLDNN_VERBOSE=1. The only difference between the library that is built w/o verbose and w/ verbose (but w/o using it) is that in the latter case every time you create a primitive descriptor it forms a string with the information (that would be used if a user set MKLDNN_VERBOSE environment variable). But that shouldn't affect performance, especially if you create a primitive descriptor and primitive once, and then just reuse the latter.
Thanks, I now better understand there's no real performance cost involved as long as I don't export MKLDNN_VERBOSE=1
